text: Denver Energy Center is an office complex in Denver, Colorado. It consists of Denver Energy Center I and II. Both buildings are owned by Rosemont Realty Inc.http://www.bizjournals.com/denver/blog/boosters_bits/2013/04/rosemont- buys-denvers-world- trade.html?ana=e_den_bn&u;=nQiEnPSABYHApqRBg7y9UBigAlK&page;=2 It was formerly known as Denver World Trade Center, which is moving to another location in Denver.https://www.bizjournals.com/denver/blog/real_deals/2015/01/denver- world-trade-center-building-to-become.html ==Facilities== Denver Energy Center I is tall and was completed in 1979 at 1625 Broadway. It has 28 floors. Denver Energy Center II is tall and was completed in 1980 at 1675 Broadway. It has 29 floors and is the 29th tallest building in Denver. ==Gallery== Image:Denver CO DT WTC AMH 322.JPG| Image:Denver Skyline 02.JPG| Image:Denver World Trade Center at Night.jpg ==See also== *List of tallest buildings in Denver ==References== *World Trade Center Denver website *World Trade Center I ==References== Category:Office buildings completed in 1979 Category:Twin towers Category:World Trade Centers Category:Brookfield Properties buildings Category:Skidmore, Owings & Merrill buildings
title: Denver Energy Center
